featured.text: Even the development of radio and television has not diminished the importance of printing.
The first printing was done from wood blocks one letter at a time by hand.
In 1476 he returned to England and established a printing press at Westminster.
In this method of printing, individual letters were made from separate pieces of metal.

other.text: Printing is important because (A) it is a Chinese invention.
When the printing was finished, the letters could be taken apart and rearranged to print something else.

definition.zh_def: 印刷，將文字或圖像轉印到紙張或其他材料上的過程。
definition.en_def: The process of producing text or images on paper or other materials using a printing press or similar technology.
definition.example: She is printing the documents for the meeting.
